## render() function

Render a view node tree to a string.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function render(node: ViewNode): string;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

node


</td><td>

[ViewNode](./dsl.viewnode.md)


</td><td>

The view node tree to render


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

A string ready to display in the terminal

## Remarks

Recursively renders a [ViewNode](./dsl.viewnode.md) tree into a terminal-ready string. Handles text styling, layout stacking, and component views. This function is typically called internally by the DSL, but can be used directly for testing or custom rendering.

## Example


```typescript
const tree = vstack(
  text('Hello').bold(),
  text('World').foreground('#ff79c6')
)
const output = render(tree)
console.log(output)
```
